page.title: 19BIRDLIFE AROUND GRASSMOOR.
page.content: There are lots of birds to be seen at any time of the year. This is being written in June when swallows, swifts and martins are flying everywhere in the area. The house martins have made fifteen nests under the eaves of Grassmoor School. We have seen flights of wagtails, magpies, gulls, robins and redwings as well as the more common blackbirds, rooks, thrushes and sparrows. Partridges have been seen in the school playground and in the park opposite. There is at least one sparrow hawk in the area and there may be more. Nobody seems to know where it nests. Some herons have been seen near the ponds at Williamthorpe Colliery. Wild geese, ducks and swans are often seen there.
